message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest pancreatic cancer, which is often associated with elevated CA-19-9 levels. Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) is most commonly used in the diagnosis of liver cancer, and CEA (carcinoembryonic antigen) is often elevated in colon cancer. PTHrP (parathyroid hormone-related protein) can be elevated in certain cancers, such as lung or breast cancer, but is not typically associated with pancreatic cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and physical exam findings suggest a possible diagnosis of pancreatic cancer, which is associated with elevated CA-19-9 levels in serum. Alpha-fetoprotein is associated with liver cancer, CEA with colon and other cancers, and PTHrP with certain types of tumors that can cause hypercalcemia. None of these are most likely to be elevated in this patient's serum.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of severe epigastric pain after eating, accompanied by diarrhea and weight loss, suggest a pancreatic or ampullary cancer. CA-19-9 is a tumor marker that can be elevated in pancreatic and biliary tract cancers. The large non-tender gallbladder may suggest obstruction and biliary tract involvement. Alpha-fetoprotein is a tumor marker for liver cancer, CEA for colorectal and lung cancer, and PTHrP for certain cancers that can cause hypercalcemia.

Among the options, CA-19-9 is a tumor marker that is commonly elevated in patients with pancreatic cancer. Alpha-fetoprotein is associated with liver, ovarian, and testicular cancers, while CEA is associated with colorectal cancer. PTHrP is associated with certain types of lung cancer, breast cancer, and some lymphomas.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical exam findings suggest that the patient may have pancreatic cancer. CA-19-9 is a protein that is elevated in pancreatic cancer patients, making it the most likely option among the choices given. Alpha-fetoprotein is elevated in liver cancer, CEA is elevated in colon cancer, and PTHrP is elevated in certain cancers that metastasize to bone.
